name: Flavio Vinicius Diniz de Figueiredo
content: Flavio Figueiredo Publications Experience Teaching Flavio Vinicius Diniz de Figueiredo I am currently a Professor at Computer Science Department at the Federal University of Minas Gerais (UFMG). I’m mostly interested in data driven research focused on social, cultural, and human aspects in computing. In particular, my research bridges hypothesis-driven data science with the development of novel machine learning models for such datasets, this includes music, language/text, graphs and networks, among others. My research is mostly performed at LabUAI, in particular with the MOSAIC (Music Oriented Systems and AI for Creativity) group that lives within LabUAI. Overall, the topics of my research are: machine learning and data science for social-cultural data; music information retrieval. Regarding other academic duties, I’m quite proud to have been one of the founders of the Data Science Undergraduate Degree (BSc) at UFMG. I believe that data science and machine learning literacy are crucial skills in today’s world. I hold a PhD in Computer Science from the Federal University of Minas Gerais (UFMG), as well as a BSc also in Computer Science from the Federal University of Campina Grande (UFCG). During my studies, I was a Google Latin American Award Recipient (two years) and IBM Research Award Recipient (one year). The axis are normalized and the text considers un-normalized values Please use this version.
